content.title: PM-YASASVI: Top Class School Education for OBC, EBC and DNT Students
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.beneficiary: Students belonging to OBC, EBC, and DNT categories
content.details: The PM-YASASVI scheme provides educational assistance to students from Other Backward Classes (OBCs), Economically Backward Classes (EBCs), and Denotified, Nomadic Tribes (DNT). It funds their education from Class 9 to Class 12 in Top Class Schools identified under the scheme.
benefits: Maximum of ₹75,000 per annum for Classes 9 and 10
Maximum of ₹1,25,000 per annum for Classes 11 and 12
eligibility: Students must belong to OBC, EBC, or DNT categories
Household annual income must be less than ₹2.5 lakhs
Students must be studying in Top Class Schools
exclusions: Students studying in schools assisted under this Scheme are not eligible for assistance under any other government scheme for the same items/purposes.
content.application_process: Online application through the National Scholarship Portal.
documents_required: Valid Income certificate issued by the competent Authority
Caste/Community Certificate issued by the competent authority

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide premium education to meritorious students belonging to OBC, EBC, and DNT categories by funding their education from Class 9 onwards till they complete Class 12.

faqs.question: How is the scheme implemented?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment, in collaboration with State Governments and the National Scholarship Portal.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: All OBC, EBC, and DNT students studying in Top Class Schools with a household annual income of less than ₹2.5 lakhs.

faqs.question: How are slots allocated for each state under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Slots are allocated based on the OBC population data to ensure equitable distribution.

faqs.question: What expenses does the scholarship cover?
faqs.answer: The scholarship covers tuition fees, hostel fees, and other charges, up to ₹75,000 for Classes 9 and 10, and ₹1,25,000 for Classes 11 and 12.

faqs.question: Are there any conditions of eligibility for students?
faqs.answer: Yes, students must have a household income below ₹2.5 lakhs and maintain a bank account.

faqs.question: Is there any reservation for girls under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, at least 30% of the scholarships are reserved for girls.

faqs.question: How are scholarship funds disbursed?
faqs.answer: Funds are transferred directly into beneficiaries' bank accounts through the Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) mode.

faqs.question: How to apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Students can apply on the National Scholarship Portal with their previous class marks.
